definitions.definition: To take apart from; to take off.
definitions.example: to detach the tag from a newly purchased garment

definitions.definition: To separate for a special object or use.
definitions.example: to detach a ship from a fleet, or a company from a regiment
Now that the zipper has detached, my winter coat won't keep me very warm.

definitions.definition: Not physically attached; separated from something it could connect to.
Of a house: not joined to another house on either side.
Having or showing no bias or emotional involvement; disinterested.
Not influenced by anyone else; characterized by an impersonal objectivity; impartial.
